title: Research: Analyze motion.zajno.com for motion design patterns
description:
## Goal
Analyze https://motion.zajno.com/ to understand their motion design approach and determine what we can replicate.

## Key Questions
- How do the project components load/animate?
- What techniques are used (CSS animations, GSAP, WebGL, or simpler approaches)?
- Is full WebGL actually needed, or can we achieve similar effects with CSS/JS?
- Can we add 3D effects to project cards without heavy WebGL?

## Deliverables
Catalog of motion design types with one example of each:
- [ ] Page load animations
- [ ] Scroll-triggered animations  
- [ ] Hover/interaction effects
- [ ] Project card animations (with 3D potential)
- [ ] Transitions between sections

## Context
Shifting focus from 'scrollytelling' to broader 'motion design'. Want wow factor without overengineering.
